means: 不以为然地，不赞成地，非难地

sentence.Network_cn: 安东尼奥不赞同地看着他。

sentence.Network_en: When I suggested a drink, she coughed disapprovingly.
sentence.Network_cn: 我提议喝一杯时, 她咳了一下表示反对.
他摇了摇头,表示不赞成.

list.abs: Prettybmay suggest a delicate feminine appearance and can be used disapprovingly of men .可指娇媚温柔的容貌，但也可用于男子，含贬义。

entry.tran: 不赞成的;表示反对的;不以为然的
entry.def: A disapproving action or expression shows that you do not approve of something or someone.

example.ex: Janet gave him a disapproving look.
example.tran: 珍妮特不满地看了他一眼。

auth_sentence.content: Kaiser, not surprisingly, glared at me disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Kaiser, not surprisingly, glared at me disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kaiser, not surprisingly, glared at me disapprovingly.

auth_sentence.content: Some of Petraeus's aides took note of his decision disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some of Petraeus's aides took note of his decision disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some of Petraeus's aides took note of his decision disapprovingly.

auth_sentence.content: I hope this isn't giving you ideas, Sylvia said disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content: I hope this isn't giving you ideas, Sylvia said disapprovingly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I hope this isn't giving you ideas, Sylvia said disapprovingly.
